medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain with radiation to bilateral lower quadrants.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began around 8 hours after eating a slice of bread and has been occurring intermittently for an unspecified duration. The pain typically lasts for about 20 minutes and dissipates. Episodes had been occurring once per week. The patient experienced severe pain this time, described as feeling like labor, which led her husband to advise a visit to the emergency department. Pain was relieved by morphine and worsened with standing straight up.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of cholecystectomy (CCY) with a similar pain episode in the summer, history of vaginal births, first birth complicated by retained products of conception.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother (MGM) with Crohn's disease, mother with asthma.
medical_history.social_history: Children have been waking up at night causing sleepless nights, and the patient was started on oral contraceptive pills (OCPs).
